definition: to behave unscrupulously
to abandon restraint/to do as one pleases/comfortable (dialect)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
absurd/fantastic/presumptuous/rash
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: The government is riding roughshod over the people's rights.
sentences.chinese: 政府恣意妄为不顾人民的权利。

sentences.english: He worked with China to get new sanctions on rogue North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 他还与中国一起，对恣意妄为的朝鲜实施新的制裁。

sentences.english: Gone were the days when they could do what they liked to the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 他们对中国人民恣意妄为的岁月一去不复返了。

sentences.english: Japan will reap as it has sown, if it continues to act recklessly.
sentences.chinese: 日方如继续恣意妄为，必将自食其果。

definition: see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
to take rash action
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
wantonly/recklessly/willfully
to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
to indulge/to connive at
to act as one thinks fit/to have one's own way
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
arrogant and willful
recalcitrant/unreasonable/peevish
imperious/peremptory
